review: Immediately greeted. Small amount of guest already for Christmas Eve at 11 am.  Our waitress Jess (jessica) on the receipt provided phenomenal service. We have a 10 month old baby. She assisted and provided high chair. She asked what we like to drink. We ordered water and coffee and Jess offered us baby water. Thank you for thinking of the baby. Ordered our food and we ordered a side turkey patty for the baby which Jess brought that out a short time later before our food and it was appreciated. Jess was attentive to us & provided excellent customer service with a smile. Thank you Highly recommend this place & ask for Jess. Just noticed $1.99 entertainment fee. I am assuming that tablet on the table which we didn't use.  Not really sure what that is but I will call after Christmas.

The last time I went here, about a month ago, I was shocked. We went in and made our way to the hostess. 3 girls stood looking at us and then 2 walked away and the 3rd ignored us like we were invisible. Still standing there, patiently waiting. Waiting, waiting.....Suddenly the 3rd girl asks us if we had been helped!!!!!! What! You were standing right in front of us, ignoring us and pretend not to know we were not helped? This is totally unacceptable. My hubs looks straight at her and says ," you stood right there and ignored us as though we didn't exist, I will spend my hard earned money elsewhere! "We quickly walked out and went to always dependable Yolanda's.  Really people? What has happened to customer service? We did complain to their headquarters. They said they would handle it. Of course they had to say they were sorry. A meaningless sorry. Our complaint fell on deaf ears. We never heard a peep from anyone at Red Robin.

Even though I have lived nearby for over ten years, this was my first time trying a Red Robin.  I love their commercials and every time I see one I tell my wife, "Maybe we should try that place." She always says, "You know you're not going to like it.  It's not your kind of place."  She has a valid point.  This is definitely not my kind of restaurant.  They probably have 40 or 50 different varieties of hamburgers on the menu and none of them appeal to me.  I don't need a lot of weird stuff on my burger and if there's going to be sauce added, I want to be the one applying it. Yeah, I know they have a straight up hamburger with none of the extraneous toppings.  OK, that might work.  But hold up, what is the fries situation here? Steak fries?  Oh hell no.  Not with a burger!  With a steak, maybe.  We'll talk.  But steak fries don't work for me in a burger situation. OK, maybe my wife is right (she always is). At first glance, it's not my kind of place. But then I discover that Red Robin has a customer loyalty program, and they give you a free burger on your birthday.   I thought to myself, "Hey, I have a birthday!  I bet I could qualify for one of those free burgers!"   Suddenly Red Robin is becoming more and more like my kind of place.  I went to their website and signed up lickety split! Then, while I'm on their website, I check out their menu.  Pages and pages and pages of the most beautiful hamburgers imaginable.  Beautiful, I'll admit,  but to me, unappealing.  I was almost ready to give up.  But then I noticed they serve patty melts.  I love patty melts!  And what's this? They have French Onion soup, too?  Hey, I now I'm getting into this. So I drop by today to enjoy my free birthday patty melt.  I requested a booth and Dolores, the hostess, led me to the back of the restaurant where they have small two person booths.  I'm only five foot one, but I was a little cramped in that tiny booth.  I asked for a table change and Dolores cheerfully accommodated my request. My waitress, Monica, was at my table moments later.  I mentioned it was my first visit to Red Robin and she explained what I needed to know and answered all my questions.  After my meal was delivered she kept an eye on my table, ready to bring anything I needed. I started with a cup of French Onion soup, because I love the stuff!  As it does everywhere, it came with a cheese topped crouton and that had been passed under a broiler.  The crouton here was very good.  Toasted and buttered on each side, it's covered with just the right amount of bubbly melted cheese.  The crouton was the best part of the soup.  That's not optimal, of course.  But it is not surprising, either.  In restaurants that don't specialize in French Onion soup, its's quite common.  Not necessarily a deal breaker.. As for the soup itself, the broth was good.  But the onions in the soup were wayyy undercooked.  You would expect them to be so limp they almost melt into the broth.  These onions still had the same shape they did when they were cut. I couldn't tell if I had a bowl of C's or U's. Undercooked onions in French Onion soup?  That's a deal breaker. But, did I mention the broth was tasty?  Yes, because check this out: right when I finished off the delicious crouton, the hostess brings over an additional two slices of toasted bread.   OK, I was just about to give up on the soup.  But with back up bread I was able to take care of all that broth.  Still had to work around the undercooked onion pieces to get at the broth, but it was worth it. I have to say I liked the patty melt, despite the fact that it was totally over cooked. Monica asked if I wanted it a little pink, and of course I said Yes!  So, I was a little disappointed, but it was still hella tasty.  The grilled onions were undercooked (again? WTH?) and you can barely taste the rye in the marble rye the sandwich is served on.  Nevertheless, it was still a tasty sandwich.  Did I finish it off?  Pretty close! I ordered my steak fries well done.  That was stupid.  I should have just left them alone.  You live, you learn.  LOL. Washed it all down with a Strawberry Lemonade.  OK, first time trying one of these and I liked it.  I liked it a lot!  Polished off one, they brought me another.  God bless this country! Will I go back to Red Robin?  Definitely!  I'm scheduled for another birthday next year. I kid, I kid.  Of course I'm coming back.  I just found out they have bottomless root beer floats.   I almost wish I hadn't found out about that!   I accept your challenge, Red Robin!  (evil laugh) I'll tell you what: this is a fun place to eat, and I had great, really great service.  The employees clearly take pride in their jobs.   Mikey C says: thank you for the free birthday burger, Red Robin!

First time trying Red Robin So I went in looking at the menú they gave me and asked for a burnin love without cheese and chipotle mayo, the time was perfect but when they brought me my hamburger it had cheese in it I was kinda sad and told the lady it had cheese so they took the burger and the manager came out to apologize and tell me "there making your burger right now " ...right away they gave me another hamburger without the cheese but the fact that the manager took his time to talk to me I was happy , little words can mean so much

I visit this Red Robin very often. My favorite dish is the buzzard wings which are on a special menu for $5! I am a buffalo wing fanatic and can truly say these are some great wings ! Their burgers are always what the picture depicts which is usually rare. The only downfall I have seen with visiting this place is the amount of fries they give you with a bottomless fries order. I have on most occasions gotten less than half of a basket full of fries. I would appreciate more fries since they are bottomless. Otherwise the service is great.
Best service by Misha I'm so impressed by her. This beautiful young lady will get far in life!

We ate at the Santa Clara location. ( near Levi Stadium).  We ate there twice in our 2 day stay.  I had fish and chips( 1st) meal my son had the burger  with bacon and egg on it. He said it was delicious. It was huuuge. Bottomless fries way cool   We also had the "Tower of Onion ringsThat would have been a meal in itself.  The next evening we both had the French onion soup It was  Excellent!   Service was superb both evenings.  Definitely a positive experience. Will do it again.

Been to this Red Robin a few times. I usually order take out. This time they gave me not even half an order of fries. Can't believe I paid $20 for this. I won't be back anytime soon, feel ripped off. Unfortunately I didn't get to see this until I opened the box at home. I ordered 2 sides of the special ketchup for my fries, which costs me .75 cents each. I didn't even get to use the extra ketchup.  Pepper & Smoke Burger was good though.

Pretty disappointed at this visit. I'm a semi regular here and am usually NEVER disappointed. Steak fries? YEA! Royal Red Robin? You bet. But this visit was SAAAAAAAAD.  Came in at 3:30. Not busy at all. We were seated right away and then the server took our drink orders. Drinks took FOREVER, and we only had a few sodas and a few kids lemonades. and that's it. The bar wasn't busy to warrant the length of time before we got our drinks. It was over 10 min easy.  Ordered the Whisky River burger well-done. This burger was ICE COLD when it was served to us. If I requested it WELL DONE, how could it have been sitting under the heat lamp for so long? Shouldn't it have been cooked TO ORDER? The bun was stale and as hard as a rock. It was as if someone ordered this exact burger 2 hours earlier, changed their mind, it was put under the heat lamp, then served to us. I wasn't going to say anything but the sever came by and asked so I told her the deal. She took it back and said she'd bring another. Even before serving us a COLD burger, our server was grouchy. Didn't crack a smile, nothing. Sure we had kids in our party but you work at RR. It's what you do! Her attitude was SO STARKLY different than the host who was climbing all over himself asking us if the location our booth was OK. He said he "wanted to make sure his customers were happy".  The manager then brought out our NEW COOKED burger. I had to request fresh hot fries because our fries were cold with said burger. Surprised the manager didn't even acknowledge the cold burger, since SHE was the one who brought the HOT one to us. This is the manager with short hair (female) and wears the trendy eyeglasses. Just a pretty cruddy visit all around.  Positive note: The kids liked their meals, the fish & chips were served very hot! Just wish the rest of our food had been.

When I told my hubby that I have never had Red Robin, he looked at me all sideways. He then went on to say how amazing the food was and reminisced on all the memories he had when coming to a Red Robin throughout High School and as a child. With this said, I said...why the hell not, let's go there for dinner...which was perfect because we went right after the gym.  RR is located on the west side of the Pacific View Mall (next to CPK) with entrances from the parking lot and or the mall itself. The hostesses put your name and party count into their iPad and then the waiting begins; we waited about 15 minutes-which wasn't too bad because there was already a line when we arrived.  We were seated next to the FULL BAR which was nice because there were multiple TVs playing the football game, plus we were seated away from all the parties with smaller (rowdy) children. Our server, Amy "Christine" was fine. She always seemed busy but still had time/remembered to attend to us. They have these iPad looking things at each table. Using this mini iPads you can order appe's, dessert, and non-alcoholic drinks. At the end of your meal, you can also pay your bill using these iPads on the table. After ordering our food was out within 15-20 minutes or so. Feel free to check out /like my pics from tonight's dinner. The burgers are pretty big and juicy. Highly recommend getting your bigger with some pink (medium cooked) and ask for shredded lettuce. I had the Fiery Ghost Burger, which was not spicy at all. It was fresh and had deep fried jalapeños inside. My hubs order the BBQ burger. His was just as juicy and messy to eat, all very tasty good stuff. Best thing about our dinner was the bottomless, thick cut fries. Okay, so what you do is...when the fresh fries arrive... You grab the RR Red Seasoning and just shake it all over your fries and Boom. Delish!  #BottomlessFries =Unlimited Fries ...mhmmmm. As my first visit, I would to say this place is not that bad for being part of a corporate chain.

Stopped at red Robin today for dinner. We always enjoy the California burger and a small order of onion rings. Misha was our server and made our meal very special with her personality and conversation. We were very disappointed in the remodelling going on in the restaurant. It no longer has the happy go lucky fun pictures on the wall. The wine bottles hanging by a string  over the bar is extremely tacky. Removing the carrousel horse is losing the whole atmosphere of the restaurant. Don't know what someone was thinking to make any of these changes! Please bring us back the old Red Robin we love!

Great burgers. Great bottomless fries. Great service. I always order the buzz boneless buffalo wings as an app. And always OBVIOUSLY get a burger for dinner. I drive down from Santa Barbara cuz it's always worth it. Yummmmmm!

Jess was our server, to put it completely frank- she had a horrible attitude. I like red robin but they need to fire her if they want returning customers. She was curt, interrupted constantly, and hardly smiled. I'm in the restaurant business myself and attitude like that would get me fired ASAP

Reeeed Robinnn... I've got the jingle in my head right now.  Somethings seriously wrong with the amount of useless information I have stored in my brain. Red Robin is your standard Chain Restaurant, flashy and colorful when you enter, somewhere between a 50's malt shop and full fledged bar. The hamburgers are loaded and juicy, my favorite has always been the Whiskey River BBQ burger with the onion straws, it's a messy burger to eat, but so good. You can request a wheat bun if you so desire, and they will specialize your order and I've never had to send anything back as yet. No diet food here, everything is loaded with mucho fat grams so may the force be with you. Whomever does the hiring, has a great eye and picking personable people because in the time I've gone to Red Robin I've always been greeted with courtesy and a smile.  Red Robin is the place to go when meeting up with friends, have a drink, order a burger and catch up on old times.

Well we are in Ventura that day and the wife decided she want to go to the mall and shop but all the kids were hungry so we ate at red Robin the place is always consistent each red Robin I've been to this a great decor little busy and they do have a new rewards program that's pretty nice
Love love love Their mamy burgers and fish. Come here when ever we are out shopping. But I hate how Yelp makes you write ore than you want.
We run our kids since they are 2 and 6 but our waitress Misha was absolutely awesome. Great customer service and we didnt feel rushed or like we didnt belong. Will be going back to have dinner soon.

I was doing some shopping at the mall so me and my son stopped in for lunch. My son is 5 years old so I was a little disappointed that the menu wasn't paper with crayons like most restaurants. Our waitress was very friendly, I ordered the guacamole bacon burger and my son ordered the kids macaroni and cheese. The burger was good except I expected more guacamole it barely had any to the point I couldn't even taste it. My son liked the macaroni but the side mandarin oranges were disgusting. They were soaked in a sort of syrup and just tasted bad. My French fries were cold and overcooked and just tasted like frozen fries you throw into the oven. My son had a milkshake which was pretty good but overall I don't think I will be returning to this location.

Popped in to the Pacific View Malls, "Red Robin", lunchtime, December 13. I was greeted at the door by a bubbly Samantha, who recommended any of the great burgers. After being seated and having made my selection, all I need now is my server. Molly passed by the table and stated; "she would be right there". She wasn't. She eventually returned and took my order.  Gourmet Burger and salad. Balsamic dressing. The food arrived with a different server who informed me there's no Balsamic dressing and was gone. Molly dropped by my booth and asked if everything was good? I informed her there was no Balsamic dressing for my salad, to which she replied, "Oh yeah, we're out".  It should be noted, the booth behind me, and in front of me, had four people in each. Molly regularly checked in these booths to see if everything was OK. She never came back to my booth again. Samantha was correct, the burger was great, I left the naked salad. Overall I enjoyed my visit and would return. The burgers are really good , the service however, was very poor.

Always good.  Only complaint is that they are always busy on weekends. But I can't hate for them being so good. My favorite is the Banzai Burger or Whiskey River BBQ burger. Both come with chicken patty too if you prefer over beef.  Caitlin is crazy nice.
Food is great. Pick up service not so much. No fries. Paid for 'em, didn't get them. This seems to be a common theme with the listed complaints. I'll check better next time.
Waited 10 min numerous servers walked by us no one acknowledged us. The service has been on a decline the last few months. We used to go a few times a month. Will never stop again at this Red Robin.

Really bummed about this as I've always LOVED RR. However my most recent visit was a complete and total let down. Although our server was polite she wasn't as attentive as what we've become accustomed to at RR, especially at this location. She constantly forgot requested items and seemed to be distracted. Totally get that we all have bad days, and her service is only a tiny bit of why I've updated with a lower rating. Join receiving our meals we all sort of looked at each other wondering what happened to the burgers and fries we've grown to love. Burgers were sloppy looking, and significantly smaller. And worse off all the fries were all over cooked hard ends. All 7 of the fries on my plate. Ordered another batch and yet again, burnt, ends and again only about 7 in the basket. Now for a place that offers bottomless fries I don't get why they're being so stingy with them, or why they're all burnt ends. Maybe to cut costs?  Not sure, but I'm hoping this gets fixed ASAP!!!  I'd like to keep RR as my "go to" place.

Super busy night at Red Robin tonight. Sat at the bar because they said it would be a 15 minute wait for a table. Poor bartender was swamped, but still as attentive as she possibly could be. Ordered the whiskey river BBQ burger (with a turkey patty)... Not the first time I've ordered it, but still enjoyed it all the same.  Recommendation... Yummmm!
Great burgers, especially the Whiskey River bbq burger or chicken sandwich. Add Tavern Fries or a tower of onion rings. Pretty good service and quick seating. Consistently good for take out, as well.
Not a good place to eat anymore... Brown lettuce in my salad... Service sucked... And only one damn channel on the TV's...

Yep, like others have said, S-L-O-W service. The food could, and should, be good, but the servers (two of them especially) are inattentive. We've had too many cold veggieburgers that we've had to send back. Hey Red Robin, you want us to come back? Write us a response telling us that you've corrected your slow service. Read the other reviews, you have a problem and have for a long time.

My husband and I stopped in for a late lunch the other day and were very pleased with our visit.  The staff was polite and friendly, and we both really enjoyed our food - I got a grilled chicken sandwich and he got some sort of chicken entrée.  I really liked that my sandwich came with a bottomless side (I chose broccoli) and our drinks were refilled in a timely manner.  Service was a little slow, having to wait quite a while at the start to even be greeted by our server, and she dropped our check off without asking if we wanted dessert (we did), but other than that, we enjoyed our meal and would consider returning.

This place used to be good hot fresh food but after three separate trips I will never return to this location every time my food has come out cold or dry buns and the bathrooms were disgusting. Someone in the corporate needs to revamp the managers there

I haven't been here in 4 years, sad to say service is just as bad as I remember it.  Went in on Sunday, during a rush, which is understandable why service is a stretch. But it seems that this chain, which when it first opened was fun and roomy, became a money crunching machine. Four years ago, the atmosphere was hectic, you're lucky to get one refill of fries or a drink.  Going back to my experience on Sunday, wait time to be seated was around 10 minutes, no issue there.  We were sat at a two person booth, given our menus and told our hostess would be with us in a minute.  She came sniffling and rubbing her nose with the back of her arm, careful to not be too obvious that she was obviously sick.  She took our order, but it felt rushed, in the end we ordered a drink that they didn't have an ingredient for and while we were deciding she told us to order on the little screen on the table. Which by the way, are both a interesting and impersonal device. But we didn't finish our order, and when we told her what else we wanted she picked up the screen and told us if we wanted anything else to order on the screen.  I didn't think much of that at the moment, I was enjoying myself with my partner and we were conversing and playing a game, which goes back to how the little screen was interesting. At 1.99, if you want to have a few rounds with your friends it's a great idea. But it is an impersonal way to order drinks and food, which we wished there was an option to take it easy on the ice, we felt that this took away the appeal of a fun funky atmosphere into just a glorified fast food joint, where you don't really need a host to really take an order, and might as well go to the front to get your food.  We got our drinks, mine a freckled lemonade was filled to the top with ice. Which made it taste like lemon water, and my partners drink was also to the brim with ice, and with a small swirl of whip cream to make your own orange cream drink.  Bad drinks were not a big deal, on occasion drinks can be pretty off so we just requested low ice on the refills. We ordered the Poutine, but were given no cutlery besides two knives and napkins. It was pretty bothersome to have to request forks and wait even after we were served our appetizer and left without being asked if we needed anything. The Poutine was pretty good, we requested no gravy, the mushrooms were soft and well seasoned, fries are regular house fries, and the sauce had a nice low spice to it.  We got our meals, I ordered the waffle bun and my partner ordered the Mac and cheese burger.  We both shared half of our burgers since we were curious about the new meals.  The waffle burger was this sticky mushy sloppy mess of a thing. It tasted like orange chicken, and reeked of honey, it mushed together and fell apart easily. It was probably the most unenjoyable burger I have ever had. While the chicken was perfectly cooked, the smell was so distracting you couldn't enjoy the taste of the burger. The waffle bun was nonexistent, smashed, soggy, and really was a disappointing waste. The thing that I wished was changed was the red pepper syrup, it just wasn't appealing and really made the burger turn into a mess.  The Mac and cheese burger was lazy and underwhelming. The Mac and cheese had a bitter mellow taste, really nothing special there, it also spilled out and wasn't properly set. The meat was meat, normally I don't eat red meat, but I couldn't taste anything complex about it. It wasn't seasoned, unless the char on it is considered seasoning.  Other than that nothing about our meal was particularly good, we are members of red robin, and we ate at a few locations- and this was by far the worst location I have ever been to. But maybe it's the lack of hands that really throws this location off, they need more people. They need to be a bit more personal. I did tip the girl $5 which was more so than the suggested amount.  I didn't mind it since she didn't bring us our food while she was sick, I figure if your sick and working you must need the money. And I'm not employed right now, so I know how it is. She tried her hardest, and her service was more an issue with how the restaurant is ran rather than her personal work ethic.  If you want to try this place out avoid rush hour or dinner, unless you're absolutely craving it of course.

Tonight my family and I had excellent customer services. Our server Misha M. Greeted us with a friendly smile and welcome us as she started to take our order. She was over worked with other tables and training a new employee and still maintaining a positive attitude throughout the time we were there. The manager Angie also came over to greet us and asked how are service was and my whole family's reply was "she is EXCELLENT " I wish there were more services like her. Thank you Red Robin for our dinner tonight

We are regulars at Red Robin, not just this location but whenever we travel outside of town. To start we were seated quickly by the hostess and told our server would be with us shortly.. Uh yeah almost 10 minutes later no one came by to even introduce themselves or get our drink order.. Finally our server came and to start she is not in the right line of work, she seemed lost and out of place. Well 5-7 minutes passed no drinks and no server, we had been sitting there for at least 15-20 minutes at this point from when we first arrived and we were all starving and had not even placed or been asked for our food order! I pushed the "call server" button on the table kiosk so we could order our food, it took her another 5 minutes to come and still no drinks. Finally another server came by to drop our drinks off at our table, we didn't even have water at this point. I'm not sure if our server was new or just not a good day for her as I could see other tables around us getting served and attended too before us with other servers. Anyway our food finally came and at that point not once did our server come back to check on us, nothing I again had to push the call server button to get a refill on the bottomless fries as well as I placed my own drink order via the kiosk (since she never came back) she passed quickly glanced over and didn't stop! At this point we (table of 6) were practically done with our food and had not received not even one refill the so called bottomless fries! We waited and waited and at this point I was timing it, it took her 14 minutes to finally come to our table after I pushed the call server button! We were all done with our food by the time she brought more fries.. Horrible service! I'm not one to complain as I know it's a hard job I get it, I have worked in customer service over 20 years but we looked and counted and timed and to be honest she had at most 3 tables, and she would disappear into the back, kitchen area for what? I don't know but looking around the other servers had no problem keeping up with their tables and customers we saw them constantly rushing and hustling back and forth when ours was no where to be found!  What was to be a great family dinner at one of our favorite spots totally ruined our night plans, in at 5:45 and didn't get out till after 8 way too long due to bad service!
Worst customer service ever rude & biter especially this waiter or a somebody since she wasn't even doing her job was gross and overpriced I should have gone upstairs to sharku waaay better

I ordered the whiskey bbq hamburger, lettus wrapped a little pink inside when I received it it was cold the waitress said let me bring you another one she did. It was cold and really pink onside.  I have ordered it this way before it was amazing. I do not know what's changed. I was looking forward to coming to Red Robin and getting an amazing hamburger like always and it's just not the same.  The service is amazing

They were going to close in 10 minutes & let us ( a group of 5) come in & sit down. The server was quick to get us drinks & very nice. We all ordered burgers & they were huge and so good. I had upgraded to sweet potato fries and it was the first time I had ever had them. They were very bomb, Red Robin never disappoints.

Checked in they said wait was going to be 15 minutes but it was more like 10,cool.got our drinks right away and placed our order.i got the black and Bleu with bottomless sweet potatoe fries.the burger was ordered as medium but came well done and dryed out fries where fresh and hot

Red Robin...Yum!  The food and service are consistently good at all of the Red Robin locations we visit.  Our experience here was no different.  The host and and severs were friendly, helpful and genuinely cared about our experience.  I love that they offer satisfying vegetarian options as well.  The Bleu Ribbon Burger with veggie patty is the best.  The kids menu is great and offers a nice variety of customizable options.  Everyone in the family gets what they want to satisfy individual tastes here!

First off I've been coming to these place for a while now and we'll I can say that is an awesome place to come and hang out with ur friends and to chill, get a couple of beers. I love this location because it's right in the mall and well as soon as ur done u can just go and walk off the food. But also every time I come here I feel really welcome and the environment just feels comfortable. Love the fact that this is the only place that I know that had unlimited fries and that's a game changer. Anyhow fryers were bomb and I got the peppercorn burger which was delicious, I always get this burger and it never fails me. Also they got some pretty bomb sauces and if u want try all of them just ask for a sauce tour. Anyways if your looking for bomb burgers this is the place, they have wings shakes drinks, everything that u would expect from a burger joint! Awesome service 5 stars and 5 stars for burgers.

Our server Misha was awesome! My tortilla soup was cold but she made it right and was very attentive. We were so impressed by her excellent service even though she was very busy and training a new employee at the same time. The prime rib dip was good but I do not recommend the deep fried pickles if you have been to the south or back east. If you haven't and like pickles you will probably like them. Overall good was pretty good & Misha was awesome!!!

Oh course AFTER our meal and we paid we found a very fast cockroach looking bug lurking around our feet! Yuck! Not sure I'll go back. After seeing this I started to notice more grime and filth. Things that I probably wouldn't have noticed if I hadn't see the bug run around my foot as I picked up a crayon my toddler dropped. I've always liked RR but they don't seem to fit into my healthier lifestyle. Although I love that they have healthy sides in their kids meals. As the saying goes, "where there's one.........."

I first started dining at RR several years ago. I fell in love with their burgers and fries and enjoyed the experience for years. Recently I have been coming with my girlfriend and we enjoy the burgers and the bar/happy hour deals. The burgers seem to be consistent with quality each time and are very delicious. We recently decided to try other menu options and tried the Chicken Caesar Wrap. It was terrible. The chicken had obviously been microwaved and tasted like rubber without any flavor at all. It was clear that it was that fake chicken that is put in the microwave with fake grill marks. Needless to say, we completely avoid chicken at RR.. and now I hear the same about shrimp from other yelp reviewers. We still come to eat here, but are more careful about our ordering choices. Because it is in the mall, makes it a fun stop to get a tall beer / yummy food then go shopping :) Just stick with the burgers and you should be good!

Continued... At this point out of courtesy I requested to speak to Mark directly and let him know to cancel our orders.  We would not be frequenting his establishment any longer.  Then he quickly returned to our table and was very apologetic as was his assistant, even going as far as offering our orders to go at no charge!!!  The assistant even willing to send us away with a Gift Card for the horrible experience!!! We obviously declined! You see Mark, Jenn, and staff we don't want your food for free, we don't want your gift card, or any kind of discounts.   All we wanted was decent service and our lunch.  Nothing more!!!

If you split a burger here they will still give you unlimited fries. That is pretty nice.  Good burgers and cold beer at the mall. Good service and they really try to make it your way. This is ONE of my favorite burger places.

Went to this location with my husband to celebrate my birthday, the initial waiter didn't even wish me a happy birthday but to be passed off claiming that his shift is over. Only to see this waiter still working and helping other guests. Requested to speak to the MOD, which a lady came with tattoos, who didn't even introduce herself even after I extended my hand and introduced myself. She had no empathy and provided nothing but excuses for David's behavior. Don't go to this location because they have no understanding of how to treat their patrons and take criticism!

I used to find Red Robin to be a restaurant that offered a good value, but no longer. The trend to 'downsize' the portions while maintaining or increasing prices is not lost on this consumer. With so many other restaurant options, it will be simple to choose an establishment that values it's customers. I ordered the Simply Grilled Chicken Salad, which is essentially a garden salad with a few quartered cucumbers and a sliced grilled chicken patty. I usually like this salad, but the size keeps shrinking. It went from being served in a bowl to being served on a plate. Hardly an entree salad and at its current size is not worth the entree price. I recommend the salads at The Habit. At several dollars cheaper they are a very good value.

Today we waited 30 minutes before the waitress addressed us and asked if we wanted a drink. There where a lot if waiters but a lot of confusion with who was serving what tables. They need to get things figured out so they can get a 5 star review.

My family and I have been coming here for years and they never disappoint! The food here is DELICIOUS! Not just their burgers but their fries are some of the best fries you can have. They have decent selection of chicken sandwiches and what not. The staff is always friendly, so give them good tips! Love this place, I keep coming back!

Our family's most favorite place to go to.  It is casual dining, but a good amount of food for the money and a variety of items to choose from.   There has really never been a time we have not had a good experience here.   There staff is friendly and except for a very few times, are very quick to be at your table ready to take your order. We love burgers, and have enjoyed the wide variety of burgers they offer.   Their rewards program is so easy to sign up for and use!   Buy 9 entrees get one free!  And a free burger on your birthday.   Great food, great prices..works for this family in today's economy.
Misha really took care of us. Good drinks, good food, good service, good happy hour, good restaurant.

The burgers here are quite good. It's a nice dineresque atmosphere here too. The food is on the pricey side though. Fun place to go with friends and enjoy a good burger. One of the better burger options here in town and the strawberry lemonade is very good. I have to go again sometime.

Dinner with my Husband, Service was great. His burger was good, and my dinner was ok, only because the bottomless fries were HORRIBLE. They were old and tasted hours old, I thought we would get piping hot fries, NOT.....

Burgers are BOMB as usual!!  Service started out Great until we started asking for extra fries,  napkins, etc & she looked a bit annoyed that we were "bothering" her.  Good thing one of our burgers was FREE!!

Good place for a burger and fries. I miss their original garlic fries but the garlic aioli sauce works well. It's a good place to relax for a meal with the friendly staff. It can get busy but it's not usually to long of a wait.

This is an updated review as we ate at this location at Thanksgiving time 2011. The weather was opposite, the sun was out, 75 plus, instead of pouring pouring rain. The meal this time was evening dinner not lunch. The mall was full of us folks who have worked so long we almost forgot it was Christmas or damn too lazy. We went straight to the line in, and asked if they do sign ins, we were told no, but asked how many new when. We were meeting family and I hate to wait, so mature de said she would see what she could do. Friday before Christmas..!! I got my last present for me wife. The restaurant was busy with young families like ourselves, but not to noisy. We were shown to a table of six, family arrived. We talked, ordered drinks and ate.. I love the endless fries, but ordered fish and chips with raspberry lemonade. No desert. Excellent place.

I would love to give zero stars, but Yelp won't let me. I had the worst dining experience of my entire LIFE at this Red Robin last night. Our waitress was really nice, but she seemed super stressed and overworked (give her a break Red Robin!). The food was messed up (as in completely not what I ordered) 4 TIMES IN A ROW! How is that even possible? It turned into a hysterical joke eventually, and I finally gave up.  Our sweet potato fries were old, shriveled, and cold - when we asked for new ones, they simply threw them back in the dryer to heat them up, giving us back warm, old, shriveled fries. Their microwave bacon is so stretchy, I tied it in an ACTUAL knot. Burger patties were so dry and withered, they made Burger King look appetizing. Finally, their voodoo fries - Ewwwwww! They were the most catastrophic, hideous "fries" I've ever had the displeasure of eating. The manager did comp our entire meal, which was fitting for the situation and much appreciated (since I never did get to eat ).  I'll say the one star could go towards our poor waitress and the manager, since they were both really nice.  Other than that, I'd rate this restaurant -5 Stars.

Pros, Cons, then summary Went here with my wife and kids. PROs-  Food is great.  Good menu selection.  Burgers are good and the fish-and-chips are great.  Great dessert menu, and the Blue Moon milkshake is unique and a great idea.  Nice, tall, cold beer available...and a bar too.  Plenty of TVs to watch the games.  Location is good too.  It's inside the Pacific View Mall so you can go shopping afterwards.  The kids menu and food was good too, it was cooked in haste, and tasted fine.  Good lemonade with endless refills.  Bottomless fries too for certain meals.   CONs--No Tabasco sauce.  They used to have it, but no longer.  Takes away a lot of flavor I'm used to.  While they do have TVs, some are small, and hard to see the game and score.  (I know, if I want to see the game stay home...I get that, but sometimes it's fun to watch a game over a nice dinner out).  Waitresses are hit-and-miss, with some wanting you to hurry up, finish, and leave.  For a restaurant that big, you have to have another restroom stall.  One ain't gonna cut it.  Also, the fish and chips are good, but now you only get two deep fried fish....used to be 3. Overall, would I go back?  Yes.  The good outweigh the bad, and my wife really likes the place.  I enjoy the location and atmosphere.  Even though they got chincy with the fish and chips......I still like them with a nice tall beer!!

The WORST red robin I have ever been to. Multiple I have been served cold soup and sandwiches. Managers are ridiculously rude and condescending. Both male managers talked to myself and my brother as if we were children when we complained to him that we had waited 40 minutes to be served. About a month later I called in an order to go, even worse. Nobody addressed me standing at the bar for 10 minutes. Bartender proceeded to tell me she had no idea when my order would be ready. 20 minutes later my order is finally ready and manager Katelyn sets it in front of me and walks away. I then have to wait another 5 minutes for her to come back to ask for the sauces I had requested with the original order. She then does not say 1 word to me the entire time she's aggresively putting sauces in my bag. I asked her what her name was, katelyn, and she then finally addresses me and says "have you closed out?". I stated yes I had paid, clearly. These are just 2 of the countless negative experiences I have had here.

This is my last visit to a Red Robin - anywhere because I  have noticed a decline in quality and jacked up charges at all RR in the past two or more years. But Ventura RR is king of jip. For $9.00 you can get an order of greasy, tough, below average onion rings.  Absolute outrageous!

Be sure to read the fine print in the Red Robin e-mail promotions.  Very misleading.  The one-half price burger promotion is not really what it seems.  Buried near the bottom of the e-mail, in tiny type, is the statement that you have to buy a full-price burger before getting the second at half price.  Usually that kind of stuff is included right up front, in easy-to-read type.  Burgers and service are good, but we won't be going back.  We don't do business with folks who make you use a magnifying glass to read their promotion.  We would recommend The Habit, or In-and-Out burger, or Duke's.
Good service and good food. Definitely come by if your in the area or at the pacific view mall

Terrible service, food was cold, wrong drinks, wrong order, and our "server" became rather rude with us once we explained that our orders were wrong and cold. The manager was decent once he intervened but all in all, what a mess. I would not bother coming back here again and I recommend you don't either. I didn't expect 4 star dining at a Red Robin, but I more so didn't expect a -4 star experience.  And to boot, she overcharged us at the end!!
Everytime I go shopping at Pacific view mall in Ventura, I stop to have lunch at red Robin.  Service is cool, food is good.

Red Robin is cool. I used to really look forward to eating here. I never wait long to be seated, and the food comes out fairly quick as well. But! The whiskey river bbq chicken used to be my FAVORITE sandwich. However, in the past year, I stopped ordering anything with chicken. It seems as though they try to save wait time and don't ensure that the chicken is completely cooked. It tastes refrigerated and doesn't piece well in my mouth. I loved that sandwich ! Too many times even the chicken in the soup is too tough to chew. Hope they notice and fix it because I used to absolutely LOVE red robin :D

Great burgers and good for parties.I would recommend to bring some friends.Sometimes your food will take FOREVER to come out and it will be cold as you would know if you read Ken R.'s review.Most of the time the service and food is great and this how you feel after you keep eating because you can't get enough of the food [why did I do this to myself must stop but so good] I love bacon burgers and here there great and the fries.They have great milkshakes you will beg for.So by far this place is great but not always!

If I wanted sarcasm with my meal I would stay home and eat in front of a mirror, not drive to Ventura to pay for it from the waitress by the name of Sandy. Other than that Red Robin always has satisfying burgers and bottomless fries! Enjoyed my visit there except for the unneeded sarcasm from Sandy.

Red Robin is always a good go-to place for burgers and fries.  Yeah they don't make the best burgers but the steak fries are pretty tasty, they will satisfy anyone's cravings. Last time we were there my daughter was celebrating her birthday, there was 10 of us there and service was pretty spot on.   A big plus for us is that they had a vegan burger on the menu and of course how can we leave out the tower-o-rings!   Like I said, its not the best burger place in town but it definately qualifies as a confort food spot.

I always feel bad for the server that gets stuck with a massive party. Ours was a group 20 strong, almost half being kids. And that's a recipe for some service nightmares. Thankfully they seemed pretty on top of things. Kudos for them keeping their cool and keeping the drinks fresh and the plates cleared. That's not to say there weren't a few issues--you're never going to have all the meals come out at the same time, so it's probably safe to say not everyone's meal was hot. Mine wasn't, but I'm not too picky. And at the end of the day, it's a Red Robin. The burgers are always a little soggy and formulaic. But it's reliable and dependable, and you do get those fries that keep on coming. There are undoubtedly more fancy options in the area and you would do well to explore the scene, but if it's just something reliable and easy you want, you could also do a lot worse than the Red Robin at the mall.

We popped in to Red Robin about 7:30 last night for a quick burger.   There was a 15 go 20 minute wait (it was Valentines Day, so that was to be expected) so I began small chit-chat with the very nice hostess, Angie and explained that we weren't too picky about where we sat, we were open to be seated anywhere including a couple of spots at the bar.   Our wait was barely a wait at all, we were seated at very nice and clean table for two and then promptly greeted by a very friendly, smiling and upbeat young waitress named Devon.  She took our order for our iced teas and burgers.  I always order my burger a bit customized and Devon was happy to oblige and promptly took our order and within a minute or so she brought our iced teas.   Then Angie came by again and asked if everything was ok - we assured her it was.  Our burgers arrived and the order was absolutely PERFECT!!  Kudos to Devon for being so attentive.  Our meals were excellent and the service was impeccable.   To the manager of this restaurant I would like to thank you for an overall great experience.  To Angie and Devon, I would like to extend another hearty thank you for being so friendly, polite and conscientious on  a night where your restaurant was so busy.  You two do a great job and are an asset to Red Robin!! We will most definitely be back to enjoy what we know will be another great experience thank to the excellent experience we had there last night.

Not bad for a chain burger restaurant.  Love their chicken tortilla soup. Great selection of good tasting burgers. The service here is very good and friendly wait staff make it an enjoyable experience. I'm not a fan of chain restaurants but in comparison to other comparably priced burger restaurants it's definitely recommendable

Went with my daughter and grandson the other day. We were seated right away and got our drinks promptly. I ordered the whiskey BBQ burger and it was very good! Messy but good.  Bottomless fries were good but after the big burger you can't eat many fries. The also have that at table kiosk so payment was a breeze!

Waited to be seated for 30 mins, then when waitress came to take the order was told "sorry our kitchen is a little backed up so it will be about 20-30 mins for the food". Be more realistic with your times or don't take people's names for seating.
Always a winner at Red Robbin. Our server Sandy was great and the Big Sky Burger was spectacular! I know it is a chain but you can't deny that they make a mean burger.

Great place to get good fast food. Burgers are excellent chicken wraps are great. Nice to sit at the bar and have a few drinks with friends. Bartenders are always very friendly and helpful. My kids walk there all the time and get unlimited fries!!!

The burgers are really good here. The customer service is hit and miss. The food quality overall is really good. I believe it is great value for the price.  I really enjoy the endless fries. Drinks are pretty good overall, as well.

Have been waiting for our food FOREVER!!  Finally came our cold French Onion soup which they comped because of our wait but I returned it since it was cold. Wondering. what's happening with our burgers and fries? Out came our piping hot French Onion soup, this time a 360 turnabout!  Makes me wonder why they are serving us old cold soup, oh ya it's 8:00 PM and caring about their customers doesn't matter.  My dab of special sauce on my burger quickly became a manger problem, his resolution was to bring me a special sauce. I was told it's a special sauce  "Thousand Island" and what's so special about that?  Definitely, this Special Sauce tasted like tarter sauce and thousand island, very strange by itself and on fries but tasty on the burger.  Overall, very disappointing.

This Red Robin is located inside the huge Ventura Mall, making it even busier due to the relentless foot traffic there. When we initially walked in, I asked for the booth that's right next to the huge carousel horse (for picture purposes - yes, I am a picture freak), but they gave me this complicated story as to why we couldn't be seated there blah blah blah. I didn't see what the big deal was, the table was BOTH vacant and clean. That was kinda weird. Oh, well! I tried not to take that personally though. OK, now for the FOOOOOOD... We ordered the towering onion rings   - yummy and very crispy! It is the thing to get here b/c it was EVERYWHERE!! The table next to us had it, the table behind us had it, the table across from us had it, well... you get the idea! Description: 13 rings in all ~ Sweet yellow onions -- breaded & crisply fried. Served with tangy Campfire Sauce and ranch dressing for dippin'. By the way, the campfire sauce was like music to my taste buds! I got the spicy BURNIN' LOVE burger b/c a fellow Yelper recently posted a review about this particular burger, and it seem to have my name all over it - I thrive on anything HOT & SPICY. It did not disappoint. Here's the description: crisply fried jalapeño coins, tangy salsa and spicy Pepper-Jack cheese layered on top of our cayenne-seasoned burger, served on a jalapeño-cornmeal kaiser roll with chipotle mayo My spouse ordered a chicken sandwich. I thought that was not such a good choice b/c this place is mainly known for their gourmet beef burgers. When in doubt, order the thing that dominates the menu (beef burgers in this case).  My 9 year old boy got an item from the kids menu - a pretty plain cheeseburger. I'm still waiting for the day when he'll eat a burger with more than just the meat, cheese and bun! I ordered the new salted caramel shake (available for a limited time) and that was a yum within a yum Mmmm. The sweet & salty combination made for a nice caramel shake. I love the shakes here. Service was good overall. We had like 3 waitresses (including the hostess), so I could not really tell who the main server was. One of the girls (hostess) brought some complimentary apple slices for my son... funny how my boy was craving their apple slices when he won't even bother to eat the organic apples I have at home! Anyway, the hostess and all the others were very nice and attentive. Casual joint w/ a fun vibe, family-friendly, and good w/ kids (very important to me).

I used to love, love,love this place. They used to serve the best burgers. As of late, I have visited this location 4 times in the past 4 months. all 3 times I ordered a burger(regardless of how I requested it cooked), it came crunchy, charred and dry...really?   This past time I ordered shrimp- Needless to say I could have made my own better at home. I could taste the freezer burn on the shrimp.   They are also experiencing BIG problems with their water. Although they advised me it was "approved" to drink, it tastes like water from my fishbowl They are blaming it on Ventura water, but after speaking to the manager, have not made any plans to install an additional water filter(costs less than $200).   Although they do have 2 filters on their hot water dispenser....lol   Save your money and go to In N out!!!

First off let me say I don't really like this place. It's not that it's bad it's just not my personal cup of tea. I came here with my little guy and his mother to eat cuz it's one of their favorite places. Service is always been good food is always prepared well and tastes good and the place always seems to be fairly clean and well kept. It can get a little loud when it's busy but all in all most places like this too. Definitely will be a place that I'll come back to on occasion to appease others.

3 words- fish and chips.. best Ive ever had. Thats all I ever get at RR because I find that there burgers are just, ok. But  Reds Nantucket Scatter with the cod fillets and clam strips and shrimp, which they hand batter themselves, is the best seafood in the county. And Ive been to Andreas, and all the others. Maybe its just me, but I ALWAYS look forward to there fish and bottemless chips.. as a matter of fact I'm taking my family there tonight. Always a good time and very kid friendly.

OK, more bad news with the "new" Red Robin.  They not only ruined the Avo-Cobb-O salad, but with their "new" plates (which are MUCH smaller), now a cup of French onion soup was at best a half cup of French onion soup.  Seriously, it came served in a square dish that was three to four inches square and an inch deep.  The soup, however, was only 1/2 filling the "new cup".  Literally, there was 1/2 inch of soup in this square bowl!   I'm disgusted with what they have done.  I'm angry that I have to find a new restaurant with a good cobb salad.  I'm done with Red Robin, and that's sad.

I love red robin, I always leave so satisfied and content with the service I get but they need to do a better jobs with the hosting. My friends and I got there and the girl in the front seemed like she didn't know what to do, then another host came and took us to table automatically assuming it was just 2 of us and didn't ask if more people were coming (which there was) we had to walk all the way to the front again and as soon as we did they had a table for us and to walk all the way back. Just better communication would go a long way.

I love red robin but this one is always a hit and miss. The food is normally good. Service when it's bad it's all bad. I think they forget about some tables. There is one male manager there and the service is hand done much worst when he is there. I will walk away anytime I see him now. This won't be a top pick anymore. I can get a burger at another place.
Service here sucks! Waitress is so lazy and doing minimum to get by. Fries were not refilled and just plain sucks. Never coming back again.

Have coming here with my girlfriend for a date night thing the last couple weeks and this week's visit our server was absolutly great i may be wrong but I belive her name was Abigail she was awesome if this review was about her it would be 5 stars but unfortunatly I was pretty upset with the way the restraunt manager behaved in several situations I belive it was the general manager once again not positive he was rude to employees infront of customers and being a chef and kitchen manager  of 6 years and working in several restraunts that really upset me when I have a problem with someone I take them to the other room and talk away from customers bottom line is food was great shake was fantastic and servers all ways great the lack of care about the employees is the only bad thing about this location.

A new spot for happy hour Mondays through Fridays from 3-6pm and 8pm-close :) My best friend Gil A. and I came here on a Friday night at 8pm because we were thirsty for brew and hungry for some cheap eats. The restaurant was filled but we had excellent service by our waitress Lindsey. We ordered 2 pints of Blue Moon ($3.50 each), sweet potato fries and onion rings (2 appetizer items for $5) as well as a tower of onion rings ($7). Gil also ordered a rum and coke because Lindsey said they were strong for $2.50 (all well drinks are $2.50). The onion rings came out hot and fresh and the sweet potato fries were crunchy good. We even got 3 different kinds of sauces to dip them in :) The well drink wasn't that strong so minus 1 star for that but it was alright. Our total came out to $23.06 which is pretty good for the amount of food and drinks we ordered :) I would highly recommend this place for HH :D
Mark the manager was more than happy to settle this overcharge. On 7/8/2015 he gave me a $5 gift card to compensate for this error.

Great food.  Love the endless fries.  The server brought me the wrong burger and I had to wait for the correct burger.  Management apologized for the inconvenience and swiftly made up for the mistake to my satisfaction.  I will for sure eat here again.
Was once a good place for fries and sides. Unfortunately they switched to cheap ingredients which hurt the quality of the food. Not coming back.

Food mediocre, service poor. The bottomless fries gag is a waste of everyone's time. How long should you wait for a few more fries. Serve a normal amount and I am sure that would be enough. Burger was just OK, salad was poor, and the "GARLIC TOAST" that was served much later after asking the waitress twice for it, showed up burned black. Waitress said she was sorry and would get us some more (completely surprised she brought out this burned trash) but we declined as we could not put any more time into this mistake. I will not return

Went to this particular red robin last Friday for a family members birthday. Arrived shortly after 3pm and didn't get out until after 5:30pm not because we were visiting, because that's how long RR was this time. Service from our waitress sandy was incredibly horrible, she came to our table maybe 4 or 5 times throughout our meal, other team members had to assist our dinner party. Whenever sandy did come to our table she brought a very big attitude, and major unnecessary sarcasm. My family comes to this RR quite often but after this visit may just make the trip out to Thousand Oaks from now on, love RR's food but service here has been habitually terrible. To top off our bad experience at RR a few of us were almost immediately sick with vomiting etc. called to report to management and they could of cared less, putting blame else where, we were not asking for any handouts or compensation but the manager kept shining us on, they could of at least acted like they cared and noted the incident. Please think twice before stopping at Red Robin in Ventura.
Unlimited fries! Yaaaaay! The food, service, and environment is fantastic! The water smelled like a fish tank, and tasted disgusting.

Came with family and made reservations on the way to the restaurant. Seated quickly as it was a Wednesday night. I had the crab burger and other-half had the hog burger. Would recommend because of their bottomless sides. All 9 of us each had a burger and drink. Total came out to $150 plus tip. Good place for groups.

MUST READ!!! Today 10/30/15 about 3pm I went to Red robin in Ventura at the pacific view mall along with 5 other family members. Our sever name was Sandy n she was a terrible waiter!(btw I was going to leave her name out but this is unacceptable) We waited about 25 mins just for our drinks n when we finally did get to place our drink orders it wasn't even Sandy our waiter who took them down it was another lady! Sandy our waitress seemed to be helping everyone else but us it wasn't that busy either for us to be waiting so long just to place our DRINK orders! It was almost like she was avoiding our table! When she finally came to get our food order she had a bad attitude with us for no reason. We asked for napkins probably about 3 other times n each time she brought us about 4 napkins we were a group of 6 really?! Everytime we asked for something she made it seem as if we were bugging I'm sorry we are a big group we do need stuff. So once we got home 4 out of 6 of us got really sick from the food we were all throwing up. We called and complain to talk to a manger n we were told it takes 24hrs for Bactria to get to your system so it couldn't have been them who had made us sick! Basically saying they didn't care! We have all had red robin plenty of times n have never had this reaction before so we have reason to believe our waiter put something in our food! I WILL NEVER EVER EAT HERE AGAIN! N I will let everyone know my experience here! So thank you Sandy!  I gave you guys one star but only because I couldn't post it without marking one but I give you guys zero stars!

MISHA was amazing. Check up on us at the perfect times every time. She was super nice and was smiling the whole time. Definitely recommend MISHA to be your server. We been here several times and this was the best service we have had.

First off, let me start by saying that our waitress was FABULOUS. The service was definitely not an issue, and she did everything in her power to make things as good as she could for us. But unfortunately, what's going on back in the kitchen is another story... One of the main issues we had, is that I ordered a burger, and substituted a vegan patty in place of the meat patty, and then obviously ordered it with no bacon. I knew what I wanted, the waitress knew what I wanted (she repeated our order to us as she was taking it), but for some reason, the kitchen staff didn't get it. Why on earth would they think that I would want a vegan patty on my burger WITH BACON?!?! The waitress was super apologetic, and took it back to have it remade right away, but unfortunately it took them so long to make a replacement, that by the time mine came out, my husbands food was getting cold and soggy. Aside from that, everything was completely drenched in grease. I always get the garlic fries at every Red Robin I go to, and yes, they are always a little on the greasy side, but these were just ridiculous! We also ordered the fried pickles, which were so super salty we were both chugging water all day, and they were actually dripping with grease! Both my husband and I felt super sick for hours after eating there, just because we're not accustomed to eating that much grease. Once again, nothing against the serving staff (which is why I gave two stars instead of just one), but the kitchen needs to get it together!

Never ending French fries is a plus. The food is very greasy and fatty defiantly american food. I got heartburn. Kid friendly and noisy. This place is inside the mall so you can do a little shopping and then stop for lunch.
Great choices on the menu, bottomless drinks and french fries. I sure do miss Red Robin here in Santa Barbara.

I don't know what happened----but this place has terrible service lately. UNLESS Gordon---the super awesome bartender----is working, I won't eat here anymore. My boyfriend and I used to frequent this location and always received great service but in the past couple months it's gone hill so bad. We were seated at a booth one night and waited for 15 minutes---no one even came to our table. Left and went to CPK across the way. Sat at the bar a week or two ago and the girl bartender was so scatter brained. She was super nice but didn't give us silverware for our food so we ate our fries first. When she came back over we asked for more fries and silverware and she said no problem and then walked over to put in our fry order and didn't bring back silverware til the fries were done. So ridiculous. Definitely won't be going there at all anymore unless we see that Gordon is working. 5 stars for Gordon 2 stars for the rest.

We went here for dinner as my husband was given a gift card. The three of us had: Clucks n' Fries....................... $9.79 Bacon Cheeseburger ............$9.69 Natural Burger........................$7.89 Scotch/rocks...........................$4.29 2 Margaritas ($5.99 ea.).........$11.98 Clucks n' Fries were standard. The Bacon Cheeseburger needed more bacon. The natural burger was and I quote "Good" The drinks probably use an automatic pour. Just guessing. Our server was Sunday. She was pretty attentive. She was very busy. My recommendation is to order a side of honey mustard for your fries. FYI:  There is a Happy Hour at the bar only from 3-6 and 8-close. I'll post the pictures. To me the food is standard.  It does have a convenient mall location if you need to do other things like .....Shop ;-D Otherwise...I'd pass on this place. It's really average.

Adan was so disrespectful on our last visit to Red Robins. It was a group of 7 and he got frustrated because we asked for split checks. He rolled his eyes at us multiple times and in the end, he threw my friends change at her. But on the bright side, the food was good!

MmmM MmM MMM everything came out delicious!...and the waitress was very helpful, and her suggestions were very smart! only problem was that we came during the lunch rush and it took forever to get out food!!! since we ourselves were in an hour lunch we only had like 15 min to eat and pay...our meal was rushed but its all good. MmmM the honey mustard!!

Great food but they struggle at refilling my strawberry lemonade. This Red Robin is in an awesome spot...its in the very front of the Pacific View Mall in Ventura, right across from California Pizza Kitchen.   This has long been one of my favorite spots to eat in Ventura.  I am a huge fan of the Whiskey River BBQ Burger...the one with the BBQ sauce and fried onion rings.   Totally amazing burger.  Plus with their burgers you get endless steak fries.  The fries are pretty good but having as much as you want  makes them even tastier.  If you like garlic fries you can make your fries those kind for a couple of cents more.   Here is my one issue...I once had a friend who worked at Red Robin and he told me that there is a reason they take some time to refill your strawberry lemonade.  He said that the restaurant only makes money on them if you get three or less with your order.  (2 refills after your original one.)  He was a waiter there and had no reason to lie to me so I figured it might have some truth to it.  I have noticed every visit since then that they are pretty quick to bring your first refill of strawberry lemonade and then after that it takes them quite a little bit to do it again.   Heck its probably all in my head. For good burgers, good location and good fries I guess I can wait a little while for my lemonade. :0)

Of course this place is delicious But if you add football and some cold beers - :) nice little set up!! I wonder why we don't come here more?? The service was great, only prob was the hostess who was very rude to both of my kids .. As they said Thank you when we were walking out she ignored them and rolled her eyes.. I'm thinking she was a tad grumpy on today's shift. Anyway, I won't let a bitter employee take the 5 stars from Red Robin!

The burger and fries were ok, but this is one noisy restaurant.  The main dining area is a bull pen with piles of tables, hard surfaces, and loud-ish music -- totally unsuited for any type of conversation. I ordered my burger medium, and it was medium rare: doable, but softer and less browned than I wanted. I was afraid to get a well done burger (they only offered medium and well done), for fear it would be too done. I'll ask for that in the future. My fries were fine but my wife's were too dang salty. Service was fine, but I asked for relish on the side which wasn't there -- no biggie, asked for it and got it.
Busy place on a Sunday night!! Had a slight issue with my order and the manager Angie came out immediately to help. Very attentive staff and happy environment.

Red Robin Breakdown: THE FOOD: Red Robin is a chain and has pretty much standardized its food.  It's very heavy burgers with steak fries.  Mine were greasier than usual though at this location. THE VALUE:  About $8-10/burger, $3-7 drinks THE EXPERIENCE:  I moved to Ventura about two months ago.  I used to frequent the Red Robin in Santa Clara in NorCal.   **However,  at this location I had a terrible server.  Her name was SANDY.  She was rude and actually made fun of me.  We were seated at the booths near the bar.  I ordered a turkey burger and made sure there was no cheese on it (I can't eat cheese) and a rootbeer float.  When she came to take the order, I was reading the nutrition facts (this information will become relevant later). Sandy went to the bar to ask for my rootbeer float.  While there, she chatted with the bartender (another girl).  She mocked me and said "I'll have a turkey burger, with no cheese, sauce on the side, and no bun....make it really healthy and then order a FATTENING rootbeer float."  She was so loud and laughed, while having the audacity to call me "stupid" and "picky." I was really appalled by this behavior and lack of respect.  I understand the irony of ordering a healthier choice and adding a rootbeer float, but I feel that it is my five-ten extra minutes of cardio that I have the right to decide on.  It is certainly not appropriate to mock or openly complain about customers, especially with them present. For the record, I have enjoyed Red Robin in the past at other locations.  This was my first time at this location.  I enjoy the atmosphere and most of the food.  I might return to this location, but I'd be sure to request any server OTHER THAN SANDY.

I had dinner here the night before my 25th birthday, so that afterward my boyfriend and I could go to the beach nearby and wait until midnight struck.  The food is consistent across the board, really. For my pre-birthday dinner I ordered a vegan burger, which came out a little dry. Nothing too bad, though. The server was really nice, so that made up for it a little bit. When I came back about three weeks later, I ordered the onion ring tower and a basket of zucchini sticks and mozzarella sticks. The zucchini sticks were sub par, I'd say, since they were really watery, and the batter kept falling off. Meh. The mozzarella sticks were standard, pretty good. And the onion rings, yum.  Honestly, the only reason I've gone to this location those two times is that nothing else is really open late in Ventura. -_- Lame. So it's likely that I'll be back.

I enjoy a burger here every now and then, but this location is weird because it is inside of the mall. It is a lot smaller than other Red Robin locations, but they do have a decent bar. The service is 50/50 and most times I come here, I feel like the servers are very childish and not very cordial. Food is good, tried their new "tavern burgers" which are two patties, but they are thinner than their normal size. Endless fries are always a delicious treat. We went around 9pm on a Sunday and they were already closing. Seems like they have a great happy hour, so I will give them another shot.

Probably my favorite place for burgers and fries. Their bottomless sweet potato fries and honey mustard or the bottomless steak fries with ranch always hit the spot for me! I wish they would bottle and sell their ranch to me, I love it so! I recently moved and hit up this place to get acquainted. My friend and I ordered the usual and after our food took forever to get to us, there was hardly anyone in the place,  my friend's fries and burger were nice and hot, but my burger and fries were so cold I couldn't even eat it! (and that's saying a lot since I'm not that picky) I sent it back and the waitress was just like "Oh...." and took it back. There was no enthusiasm or genuineness about her at all. I had to use my free burger from my Red Royalty card to pay for crappy service and a sub par burger. Pretty disappointing. Hopefully the next time we go, it will be a bit better service.  Three stars because the food is good when it's done right and for their royalty card getting me free burgers.

Went here last night with a friend.  Not only was the food amazing but our server Evan was friendly and took the time to interact with us.  Working in customer service I know that having employees like Evan is important to business.  Had a great time and would defiantly come back.
Slow service even though place was not busy.  Food mediocre at best assuming you even get what you ordered.

Food was good, as always. But the service...made me loose my appetite. Our server, Monica, was not only rude but condescending.  After my meal arrived, I questioned that it was different than the menu's description. Before I could finish with my question, she ran away, grabbed a menu and told me that was not what I had ordered. When I tried to explain, she said "I didn't print the menu, you know." She's right...but I did print her tip on my check. Zero. Stay in school kids, or risk becoming Monica.
Edit: boooo no more single appetizers. We will not be coming here much anymore as that was a huge draw for us.
We were a party of 10 and had a great server Sandy!  She was super friendly, fast and really knew the menu.  We will be back and I hope we get Sandy!
One of my favorite places to bring the kiddos. They have a great kids menu.... The best varieties of burgers.... And my favorite place to get wings. Extra crispy please!
Consistent great burgers and food. Every time I have come in there has been horrible service though.
Went for lunch today it was good.  Everyone enjoyed there food.  We thought it was great that the lunch prices were cheaper than the menu prices on the burgers.

I would have given it a 5 stars if the service was faster and checked up on me more. The food is delicious and is the standardized Red Robin. Their bottomless steak fries come with every order so pour their seasoning all over it and enjoy. I had the Bacon Tavern Double for $7.99 and the burger was smaller than expected, but tasted very good. Amazingly, the calories for that burger were under 600 calories, but the fries for each order was 400+. I haven't had drinks here yet though, so I cannot comment on that.
We have little kids and this is a great place to go with them. Love the upbeat atmosphere and staff. The food is great, love the whiskey river wrap!

I still don't understand why this place tends to get overly busy. The service is horrible. The food is blah- I've given it a couple chances but every time I eat here- I leave with a bad experience. The burger I had  yesterday was alright (not exactly the best)- not good enough for me to remember the name.

We have been loyal customers and neighbors to the Pacific View mall for many years and have always enjoyed eating at Red Robin.  Most the time the food is great, service is never over the top and typically mediocre, but doable.  This week we came in with a party of 11 for my daughters birthday and over half of that party were children in the family.  The meal was good and the service was the same as always, mediocre.  The strange part came toward the end of our meal when we were paying our bills and the kids were enjoying time together.  The mamas and one grandmother were also enjoying some much needed conversation too.  The manager (didn't get his name) came up to us and asked if he could "bribe" us over to the back table with all the children because they needed to clean the table.  We happened to be in the middle of a conversation and he completely interrupted us and asked us to move 6 children.  I asked him to please respect our conversation and let him know that it would be too hard to move 6 children to the back of the establishment and that we were paying customers who had the same opportunity as everyone else to sit as long as we wanted at the table we paid to eat at.  To give him a little grace, he did apologize to us and told us he wasn't kicking us out (lol) but it was so awkward at that point we stopped our conversation and left.  It was such a rude way to end a wonderful Bday for my 9 year old.  He was super awkward.  We were disappointed.  The kids played with balloons together outside.  The end.

This place is pretty bad... I mean food wise.  We ordered the Red Robin burger, chicken salad, and kids pizza meal.  The burger was dry and cold.  The chicken on the salad was cold and over cooked and the salad was not fresh. The kids meal pizza was not good either.  I have been to other Red Robins so this one was a little disappointing.
Best burger in all of Ventura. Ask to sit in Jennifer's section. She is by far the best server. I don't even bother if shes not working.

A couple friends and I went in last night for dinner around 6:00. We were seated but no drink orders were taken. We waited about 5 minutes then a server came and asked if we were ready to order! We hadn't even gotten a drink order in yet but because of that time we were indeed ready to  order. He seemed new, like we were the first table he had ever waited on and we could see it, so I decided to be nice and clear and give him a good customer experience so he can get some more practice. After he fumbled to get our order down and awkwardly offered us specials, my friend told me that he had been in 2 months prior and this guy hadn't improved! Two months, at least, and he still comes off as a beginning server! Not good. Either he doesn't get it or he is playing some sort of "if I look new they tip better" king of thing but we weren't buying it.  One of my friends ordered a salad with his meal. So he came back about 5 minutes later with our drinks, no salad. I  knew that when he wrote "salad" at the bottom of his ticket that it wouldn't come out first...remember folks, drinks, apps, salads go on top of the ticket! So we sat, no salad, no fries to get us started.  Then our server spent some time talking to what looked like his family at another table, then we watched him scramble around and finally 20 minutes later our food came out, salad included. Now, here's a simple concept. Salad is cold, burger is hot. Generally people like to eat their salad BEFORE their burger. This way the burger doesn't get COLD sitting on the table while someone eats their salad. Well, the salad came with the burgers and my friend ate probably three bites of his salad before moving to the rapidly cooling burger.  Did I mention we still had no place settings? Right, no place settings. We had to ask a very hard working busser for settings, which he got swiftly....a few minutes later our server brings settings.... It was not great. The food was good for what it is and I love the concept of bottomless fries but the service was really lacking. Little care, little training, not attentive enough. I have been here before and had a much better experience but not 4 star worthy, I am afraid.

Have to admit that I was impressed by Red Robin. Normally, chain restaurants inside malls are bland and boring for all the flare they try to convey. Although this restaurant reminds me of the one in the movie Office Space, this Red Robin had some delicious hamburgers. I ordered the Sautéed 'Shroom Burger that was juicy with tender meat, and my girlfriend ordered the Guacamole Bacon Burger and she loved it. We both enjoyed the bottomless fries that were warm and crispy.  My only complaint is on the service. We were sitting at the bar that had two other people. The restaurant was busy but not full and the bar area could fit upwards of 11 people. The bartenders were friendly and cheerful but they would take FOREVER to get me my first beer.
