The bartenders were walking right by us time after time without asking what I wanted to drink. When they finally took my order they took another eternity to get my drink. I was kind of annoyed because my hamburger arrived with my first beer and I like to have a drink before the food arrives while I'm conversing.  The food was great, but the bar service is quite slow. They were friendly, but maybe it was an off night. I'll be returning in the near future and hopefully I have a better experience.

My friend and I were looking for a place that had happy hour past the usual 3-7pm or 4-7pm and we found Red Robin's. Their happy hour is from 3-6pm and 8pm-closing and that is why we went there because it was already 8pm. We are greeted as soon as we get in there, which was good because some other restaurants do not greet. We are told that we can be seated asap because even though there are a lot of people waiting outside, but that was because they were big parties and we declined because we were looking to go for their happy hour and decide to go to their bar. The thing I did not like about the bar was that it was just sitting at the bar, they did not have tables specifically for the bar because it was used for dining. Other restaurants do have specific bar sections with tables, but this place did not so that was something I disliked. After seeing this, we decide we want to be seated at a booth somewhere. We go back to the hosts and ask to be seated instead. We were seated quickly. We were served quickly and our server was very friendly and helpful. I'd give her a 10 out of 10 for being a great server. Their happy hour was a good deal. My friend and I both ordered pints of Blue Moon, which was really good. I then ordered a rum with coke, which happened to taste like nothing but coke. There was hardly any rum. I would have preferred a Blue Moon again because I definitely enjoyed that more than the rum and coke.  Overall, great hosts, server, and environment for a Friday night. I would definitely go back there for probably the only happy hour around here that starts at 8pm.  One more thing, they need to put better bathroom deodorants or something because it sure smelled bad, tis why I held my pee till I got home because I did not want to go back in there.

Went here on Saturday while waiting to go see our Grandsons soccer game.  The service was ok, but the burgers were not what we have experienced from other Red Robin restaurants including this one.  The order was not what we asked for and the burger I ordered was not what I was expecting from the menu description.  Also, we tried some of Reds new dipping sauces, but when they brought them to our table they were not what we ordered.  Sorry to say, but family that live in the area had told us they have experienced similar service and food quality here, so this will be the last time we eat here.

For the most part the servers are really great.  The food is consistent with other Red Robin Restaurants.  If there is a line to be seated it generally goes quickly.  They have a new menu and have done a good job at revamping it.  You can subsitute the fries now for a variety of items such as, steamed broccoli, sweet potato fries, cole slaw, garden salad, and mac n cheese.  It's a great place to take kids as it's loud and vibrant.   If you are at the mall, I recommend choosing this place to eat.

Endless fries is always great... But the happy changed and that's never good. Service is horrible, they also fucked up and charged me twice as much. Only reason to come is for the fries... Otherwise it's gone down hill

Absolutely great burgers!! Whisky river is my favorite. There staff are always polite, and put customer service at the highest of standards. Thank you red robin and staff for great food and a+ service.
Multiple tables open,  didn't bus them, long wait for no reason. Ended up leaving before being seated because the server seemed to lack any sort of caring as to whether or not we were seated.

The manager is a rat weasel. Upon arriving I asked the waitress to check my rewards card for what offers I had available. She returned with a receipt and said you get 20% off. I was glad and ordered a little more than usual, because, why not, I had 20% off.  At the end of the meal, rat weasel, aka the manager approached my table and said how was everything. I replied good. He continued to say"  what is that slip of paper on your table is it okay if I look at it." Of course I agreed, and then he continued to say you can only use this at lunch time. I responded that I asked the waitress prior to placing my order and she said that I had a 20% off. Rat weasel decided to just run off into the kitchen with plates  which is probably a better position for him as a busboy than a manager seeing as he has zero customer service skills. I have been a member since 2011 and I don't plan on coming back here anytime in the near future. Your manager practices are poor, your waitresses are uninformed due to the manager and your system are broken according to them. Very disappointed. I highly do not recommend going to the Ventura Red Robin. They practice the bait and switch and I look forward to contacting your corporate office.

Hit or miss. Just like the Tale of Two Cities,  it was the best of times,  it was the worst of times. Sometimes the customer service is exceptionally horrible as other times it can be remarkably satisfying.  Sometimes the food comes out all together as other times it will take a while for each item.  Therefore some dinners will eat and be done with their food before the others receive theirs. The bartending has slumped over the last year. Tasting watered down mixed drinks or missing two inches of beer is unsettling.  In addition to seeing your drink waiting to be brought to you as your thirst increases as the drink continues to get warm, the food temperature sometimes feels as if it might fall into the danager zone. The overall consistency is less than one would expect and often will leave someone with the question "is it really worth dinning here". The only positive aspect that is not only enjoyable but memorable on a positive aspect are the hostess that take you too your table.  Not only are they polite and courteous, but they are very accommodating to fit peoples personal needs.

I sent my little brother and his friends to get food and enjoy their endless fries. They were told that they could only get 4 or 5 rounds of fries. They were treated impartially due to their age, and they could feel that. They still left the waiter a generous $20 tip on a $45 bill. I was proud of them and will send them elsewhere to eat in the future.

Sherry. Literally the worst server on the face of the earth.  Thank you for ruining my night. Hope they fire you. Best wishes at the next job you wont be able to keep. Going straight home to write the corporate office a letter.

This place is alright for a chain restaurant. I got their Souper Sandwich Combo with the Caesar wrap and clam chowder. Both tasted good. As did their mint brownie shake. Prices are mid-range. But if you take a look at their Nutrition Menu, the calories for practically everything are super high. It's a good spot for groups. Our waiter was really friendly and nice.

I love you, Oktoberfest Burger! Sehr gut!! The service is always very good at this location. Old Navy is just down the way, so I invariably end up there to buy some work out clothes and head home to treadmill off the bottomless fries....
Waitress was incredible. So to was the hostess and food.. Was pleasantly surprised.. for I had never been to this restaurant.  WILL be back!
Good burgers and other stuff.  Endless fries are great.  Only problem is I eat TOO much!  Staff is wonderful.  Can get busy at peak times.

Ok guys so i went there Sunday night and boy this was by far the worst red robin ever If I could give zero stars I would but I can't so what happened was we walked in 5-10 minute wait so I think ok well that's not to bad sat down 10 minutes later ok but then then the problems began it took 10 minutes to grab Landon he takes are order I get a rootbeer and a chesebuger with fries ok so he brings are drinks but my rootbeer looks like tea it has no fizz nasty then my burgher comes out with mayo on it eww but I eat it come down with food poisoning the next day boo

I ate at red robin sunday june 8. My server was very pushy on us to get additional items but we did not get our sodas refilled till we were pretty much ready to leave. Also i got a burger and when it got to my table it was so soggy and cold i didn't finish it. It was very disappointing. I don't recall my servers name. I also went with my fiance daughter and niece and this women's cleavage was out to the extent where i did not want to look at her while i ordered anything. It was a horrible experience and I don't think I will ever eat at the establishment again.

Cater to tight assed   judgemental zealots who would rather discuss war and famine than allow anyone to show love and adoration. Shove those two thousand calorie burgers down your obese throats. Suck down that fat.

I typically have a soft spot for red robin. Yummy food even as a chain suburban dinner factory. But not this one.  I have been here three times and all were bad experiences that I attributed to the wait staff. Now I am starting to believe there aren't any decent wait staff at this location. I can be high maintenance but ignoring tables for 20 minutes, forgetting food, bringing out half the meals and making the rest of us wait, overcharging us for meals, bringing out cold food, serving food that looked like it was heated and left out then reheated, not to mention hitting the bottom of bottomless fries.  Maybe i just have really bad luck...

Usually the Red Robin Restaurants are a great place to have a quick lunch and a good hamburger.  This place is no exception as far as good food and quick service.  The problem yesterday was having to be seated in the bar even as there were tables available in the restaurant area adjacent to the bar.  The patrons in the bar had obviously been overserved alcohol and were loud and rowdy and quite vulgar.  We took about as much as we could take and asked to be reseated somewhere else.  The staff and the bartenders seemed to know these people quite welll and were taking part in making quite a few off color comments as welll as adding to the obnoxious noise factor.  We surmised that the loud and rowdy group might be off duty employees of the restaurant.   No manager around, no one seeming to care that these folks were over served and sloppy drunk.  This was at 4 PM in the afternoon. Thanks but I won't be back to this particular Red Robin no matter how good the food is.
Good burger with cold fries and soggy onion rings
Very,Very fast service. Drinks were kept filled without asking and food was great.
Their food is good but usually the lack of service and increasing prices make me not want to frequent this place anymore. Countless times my family and I have dined their and I've been unsatisfied.

I always enjoy the food here, my favorite is the A1 Peppercorn Burger. The service is always prompt and friendly, and even when its crowded your wait time is always less than the estimate. I had bad service once and filed a complaint but it was resolved very quickly! The manager called me to apologize and restored my faith in their A+ service!
Yummy at a fair price with good quick service.
Four star rating for chain restaurant.  The food was great.  The service was excellent .  It's the kind of restaurant to go to if you want quick consistent food.  Good burgers and sandwiches.
very good food here great service,i had there tavern burger very good happy customer and will be coming back!
Excellent service. Manager and bar tender were super cool. Awesome fries, salad, and burger!

Not so great.. I hadn't been to a Red Robin in a long while so i was looking forward to one of their signature burgers. The food was cold; my burger wasn't made as i'd ordered it, and we had to wait way too long for refills on our drinks. Let's put it this way: there's a problem when your favorite part of the meal is the view from your booth (we did get a pretty great seat, at least). Disappointing.

I went here today to be disappointed.  "They out the Chili Burger!"  Damn you Red Robin!  But I have to admit the Burgers are still good here even though they took my burger out.  They have a new menu with some of the popular burgers still there.  I've tried them all cause I would come here during my lunch hour for work.  My Go-to's are the Whiskey, Royal, and Banzai Burgers
Excellent service right in the middle of lunch. Our waitress kept our glasses full, and the food was served piping hot.  The food was very tasty, and their dressings were awesome as always.

Ya know I have to say I wasn't expecting much when I went here; honestly it had been a good 2 years since I had been here and last time wasn't impressed. I ordered one of their healthier items, I believe a turkey burger, and it was really good. Its nice to see that this restaurant chain is gearing towards healthier food, or at least the option to have such. I will definitely come back...also the service was very prompt and nice.

Red robin is dank as fuckkkk! I've never had better fries! Wow and the server had gauges and was super cool and talkative!!! I would recommend this to everyone because if you like bomb food, you will like red robin! !!

5 stars for the food which is always excellent, 1 star for the service and cleanliness which are always below par. The hostesses are usually indifferent at best and hostile at worst (one time, my wife and I got looked up and down and told to wait when we interrupted one hostesses conversation with her skanky looking "bro ho" friend)...every time we go the tables are still covered in crumbs or seasoned salt from the people before us, and the wait staff is also fairly indifferent to the customer's wants or needs. Unless you can get past the (high) possibility that you will get ass service, go to the CPK across the way, it is far superior and worth the extra coin you'll spend.

I really like this place :). Mainly because a good friend of mine used to come here with me...he always loved the bottomless fries...it was cute :). Their burgers are so thick and juicy...and their fries are really good! We always asked for the fries first with a side of their secret sauce to dip. Their shakes are also DEEEELLLICIOUSSSSSS! :) I'm not a fan of pickles...and sometimes when I go to places and I say no pickles...I always remember that this Red Robin does exactly what you ask...idk maybe because I'm nice to the waitress and waiters that they give you that extra effort...but I love it...

Red Robin was one of my favorite restaurants growing up , but for a period of a few years there, it seemed like it was starting to go downhill rapidly.  The classics were still there, but the quality was starting to slip and the menu had grown stale and uninteresting.  But they have made a concerted effort to improve and it shows.  I have been really impressed with my meals on my last few visits.  The quality of the ingredients is back and better than ever and they have added some truly innovative burgers and sandwiches to their menu including a turkey burger that has pickled onions and goat cheese with avocado on it that looked very good.  You don't see that combination in chains too often.  I had the Burger Parmigiana - a burger on ciabatta bread with  onions and peppers, a fried mozzarella round (basically a round cheese stick) topped with marinara sauce - and it was delicious.  I've never seen fried cheese on a burger before but I wish I could see it more often.  It was also served with their steak fries covered in garlic and parmesan, as if their steak fries needed any improvement.   My wife had my long time favorite, the California Chicken Burger - chicken, guacamole, bacon, lettuce, tomato - and it was fresh and good as always.     Now if only they would work on updating their decorations a bit.  The Ventura location looks particularly old and it doesn't help that this is one huge, totally open restaurant while a lot of the other ones are a bit more cozy.   Also, they close at 9:00 and we came in at 8:00 and were made to feel weird about it.  The staff was obviously in cleanup and go home mode instead of service mode.  There ended up being five or six groups including a family of eight that came in after us.   I guess they jinxed themselves, serves them right.
This is the shit my daughter said her Mac and cheese is so good she loves it so do I :)

I loved this place in the OC because of the bottomless fries. So I excitedly invited my family to eat here at Pac View Mall. It was just okay for me. My family wasn't very impressed. Just average, nothing special here.

I love the buzzard wings that Red Robin makes, the wing sauce is delicious, I like to dip my fries in ranch followed by the wing sauce. The only reason that it is four stars instead of five is that sometimes the waiters/waitresses take a long time to bring dips, refills, etc. even when it's not super busy.

Lunch at the Red Robin yesterday seemed like a good plan after some dreaded mall shopping..... We were instantly seated at a booth situated directly in front of the entrance, this didn't seem like a bad place to sit at the time.........Every person that entered the doorway after us had to wait a very long time before being noticed, sometimes people would stack up in pairs and peer in with angry expressions making it kind of uncomfortable (I've seen hungry people do crazy things before) The worse part was that this was a slow period for them and they clearly were staffed properly, it was poor management! One time the manager breezed right pass two waiting couples to go say hi to someone, leaving the waiting customers standing there 5 more minutes until the hostess wandered out to seat them. Our server was nice but really blew it twice, we asked if they had sliders? (even explained what they were) His response: No, but when I worked at Marie Calender's they had them there (nice, but we're not there are we?) OK, no big deal, we placed our order and waited......... While waiting for our order I noticed a huge banner placed pretty high up on the wall promoting their new SLIDERS in fact as I looked around there were little promos everywhere!!!! LOL, we had a good laugh and decided to not even mention it. I ordered the Cobb salad, my sister ordered the soup and salad combo and for the sake of being a little bad, we decided to split an order of their steak fries smothered in Red Robin salt.   After 35 minutes had passed and just being served beverages we started peering around with angry expressions too(after all it's really just salads so what's the hold up?). Our server finally appeared at our table to inform us that he messed up and has now sent our order to the kitchen and he will, "throw rocks at them to make them move faster" what? After another 20 minutes our food arrives but the waiter forgets the fries and after being reminded brings them last.   The food was good, we enjoyed it, but the service is part of the package and it really could have been so much better. Lastly, the restroom was filthy, it smelled absolutely horrible, and to make matters worse they were out of seat liners and hand towels which BTW were all over the floor. When was the last time anyone cleaned the bathrooms??? No excuse for sloth, ever! Minus 3 stars for really poor management.

Red Robin is a national, family-friendly, chain specializing in everything a typical Red Blooded American could want: Lots of fatty foods and carbs to make you feel fat and happy at the end of the meal.  Many varieties of hamburgers, fries and shakes grace the two page menu allowing people to eat more calories in one meal than many people in third world countries will eat in their lifetime. Souring you on the obesity potential of this restaurant is not what I want to do though. They do have lighter fare on the menu too, but if that's too healthy for you, they can fatten them up by adding real bacon bits or even slices of fried chicken, not to mention the salad dressings.   In health-conscious California you would think that this chain wouldn't be doing too well, but apparently Ventura residents like their Red Robin. I do too actually. It's a great family place, with a good kids menu and healthy options for everyone... if you know how to order correctly. Today the kids split a fish and chips and my wife and I split the cobb salad with dressing on the side. We all shared everything though. Sure, I've been here and ordered one of the special burgers with onion rings and a strawberry shake, but once I turned 30 my metabolism slowed to a tricycle speed. I'd have to run a hundred miles to burn off that many calories now. To be healthy when you order, make sure to ask how things are made and if there are any healthy options, like the garden burger mentioned in other reviews. The waitress we had was very accommodating with our requests (dressing on the side and splitting entrees) . So go and have a burger every once in a while, but if you can't handle the fat or the carbs, they can help you out.

Red Robin is one of my family's favorite restaurants.  When we're all bickering because everybody wants something different, we go to Red Robin and everyone's happy.  Even my picky daughter.  My favorite thing at RR is the seasoned fries.  Mmmmmm.  And I like that I can order any burger with a gardenburger instead of meat.  The servers are always friendly and helpful.  And how cool is it to be able to drink a couple beers and then go shopping in the mall?!?  Makes my crappy little mall a bit more enjoyable.
